channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: National Guard says members patrolling D.C. 'may be armed'
item.description: National Guard members and federal law enforcement officers are patrolling the city as part of President Trump's effort to assert federal control over policing in the District.
item.content:encoded:
National Guard members and federal law enforcement officers are patrolling the city as part of President Trump's effort to assert federal control over policing in the District.

(Image credit: Tasos Katopodis)
item.dc:creator: Joe Hernandez

item.title: Air Canada suspends restart plans after union defies return to work order
item.description: Air Canada will resume flights Monday evening, claiming the union illegally directed flight attendants to defy a return-to-work order.
item.content:encoded:
Air Canada will resume flights Monday evening, claiming the union illegally directed flight attendants to defy a return-to-work order.

(Image credit: Graham Hughes)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: After meeting Putin, Trump changes his position on the need for a ceasefire
item.description: When President Trump was flying to Alaska to meet Vladimir Putin, he said the goal was a ceasefire. But after they talked, Trump aligned himself with Putin and downplayed the need for a truce.
item.content:encoded:
When President Trump was flying to Alaska to meet Vladimir Putin, he said the goal was a ceasefire. But after they talked, Trump aligned himself with Putin and downplayed the need for a truce.

(Image credit: Andrew Harnik)
item.dc:creator: Greg Myre

item.title: One neurosurgeon, 8 million patients
item.description: Alieu Kamara is the first and only neurosurgeon in Sierra Leone. "Before Dr. Kamara, there was no hope," said professor Kehinde Oluwadiya of the University of Sierra Leone Teaching Hospital Complex.
item.content:encoded:
Alieu Kamara is the first and only neurosurgeon in Sierra Leone. "Before Dr. Kamara, there was no hope," said professor Kehinde Oluwadiya of the University of Sierra Leone Teaching Hospital Complex.

(Image credit: Sophia Li for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Sophia Li

item.title: Hurricane Erin downgraded to Category 3 storm
item.description: Heavy rain is still expected across the Virgin Islands and Puerto Rico, with rainfall of up to 8 inches in some areas.
item.content:encoded:
Heavy rain is still expected across the Virgin Islands and Puerto Rico, with rainfall of up to 8 inches in some areas.

(Image credit: Alejandro Granadillo)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: European leaders to join Ukraine's Zelenskyy for White House meeting with Trump
item.description: European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen and NATO Secretary-General Mark Rutte are among those expected to attend.
item.content:encoded:
European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen and NATO Secretary-General Mark Rutte are among those expected to attend.

(Image credit: Ben Curtis)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Washington's hydropower has created a data center boom. Some are concerned about its future.
item.description: In small town Washington — where hydropower is plentiful — data centers are creating jobs and funding amenities. But water and energy aren't unlimited — and some worry about long-term sustainability.
item.content:encoded:
In small town Washington — where hydropower is plentiful — data centers are creating jobs and funding amenities. But water and energy aren't unlimited — and some worry about long-term sustainability.

(Image credit: Megan Farmer)
item.dc:creator: Monica Nickelsburg

item.title: Three Republican-led states to send hundreds of National Guard troops to Washington
item.description: West Virginia said it was deploying 300 to 400 Guard troops, while South Carolina pledged 200 and Ohio says it will send 150 in the coming days, marking a significant escalation of the federal intervention.
item.content:encoded:
West Virginia said it was deploying 300 to 400 Guard troops, while South Carolina pledged 200 and Ohio says it will send 150 in the coming days, marking a significant escalation of the federal intervention.

(Image credit: Julia Demaree Nikhinson)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Hundreds march to White House to protest Trump's D.C. crackdown
item.description: Protesters marched to the White House on Saturday as D.C. Metropolitan Police officers and National Park Service police looked on from a distance.
item.content:encoded:
Protesters marched to the White House on Saturday as D.C. Metropolitan Police officers and National Park Service police looked on from a distance.

(Image credit: Brian Mann)
item.dc:creator: Brian Mann

item.title: State Department halts 'medical-humanitarian' visas for people from Gaza
item.description: The U.S. State Department says it's halting visas for visitors from Gaza as it reviews its process for granting visas for medical evacuees.
item.content:encoded:
The U.S. State Department says it's halting visas for visitors from Gaza as it reviews its process for granting visas for medical evacuees.

(Image credit: Mehmet Eser)
item.dc:creator: Rhitu Chatterjee
